WorkItem.Description:
Having double-checked my current gear, my defence stands at 116 and resilience at 26. In WoW, this works out to -1.96% and -0.66% to be crit, for a total reduction of -2.62% to be crit.

Rawr, despite having the same resilience and defense rating figures, has me at 0.0007153034% chance to be crit.

Comments.Message: The WoW character screen reports incorrect values right at the margins (155 defense rating is one of these, and you've found another).  You really aren't uncrittable with 116 dr/25 res.  Can probably close this issue.

Assuming the article here: http://www.wowinsider.com/2008/01/29/shifting-perspectives-hit-rating-expertise-and-defense-skill-f/ is correct. Then the bear is uncritable calculation is definitely off.

The Bear calculations are taking all defense rating and dividing by 60 to determine crit reduction when in fact it's closer to 59.10 for a direct defense rating to % crit reduction. This can be confirmed in game with the script "/script DEFAULT_CHAT_FRAME:AddMessage(2.6-(GetCombatRatingBonus(CR_DEFENSE_SKILL)*.04+GetCombatRatingBonus(CR_CRIT_TAKEN_MELEE)),1,0.5,0)". At 81 defense rating and 49 resilience in game shows uncritable but Rawr shows critable.

I modified the crit reduction calculation in the function CharacterCalculationsBase GetCharacterCalculations(Character character, Item additionalItem) to read
"calculatedStats.CritReduction = (((float)Math.Floor(stats.DefenseRating * 0.423f)) / 25f) + (stats.Resilience / 39.423f);"

This should properly convert defense rating to defense skill, round the defense skill down to the nearest integer, then convert that to % crit reduction. This all of course assumes that the linked article is correct in it's theory crafting.

I believe that article is wrong. Its calculations are based on a macro based on the character sheet which has always rounded when it shouldn't.

If someone can do some tests with thousands of hits at these borderline def/resil cases, that'd be interesting. As it is, I'm going to go with the leading theorycraft, which also happens to be the most conservative.

Yeah definitely worth a few thousand hit test. The EJ forums show 60 defense rating = 1% crit but even the warrior summation on EJ shows 59.10 ( 2.3645 or there abouts ) per crit%. It would be interesting to see which is correct.

Of note: The above is rounding down not up when converting defense rating to defense points. So that can't be where a rounding error is happening in game.
I should clarify. The druid tanking thread on EJ describes the defense rating to defense skill differently than the warrior tanking thread on EJ. Which is correct is the real question.
